content:
PropertyValueCollection Class

In this Article

Contains the values of a DirectoryEntry property.

Syntax

Declaration

public class PropertyValueCollection : System.Collections.CollectionBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Collections.CollectionBase
  • PropertyValueCollection

Retrieves the index of a specified property value in this collection.

Inserts a property value into this collection at a specified index.

Remove(Object)

Removes a specified property value from this collection.

Properties

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets the property value that is located at a specified index of this collection.

    public object this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the property value.

    Property Value

    • Object

      The property value at the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The property value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • IndexOutOfRangeException

      The index is less than zero (0) or greater than the size of the collection.

    Remarks

    In C#, this property is the indexer for the PropertyValueCollection class.

    In JScript, you can use the default indexed properties defined by a type, but you cannot explicitly define your own. However, specifying the expando attribute on a class automatically provides a default indexed property whose type is Object and whose index type is String.

  • PropertyName

    Gets the property name for the attributes in the value collection.

    public string PropertyName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains the name of the property with the values that are included in this PropertyValueCollection object.

  • Value

    Gets or sets the values of the collection.

    public object Value { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Object

      If the collection is empty, the property value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). If the collection contains one value, the property value is that value. If the collection contains multiple values, the property value equals a copy of an array of those values.

      If setting this property, the value or values are added to the PropertyValueCollection. Setting this property to a null reference (Nothing) clears the collection.

    Remarks

    To add multiple values, set this property to an array of the values.

Methods

  • Add(Object)

    Appends the specified PropertyValueCollection object to this collection.

    public int Add (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      The PropertyValueCollection object to append to this collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the PropertyValueCollection object that is appended to this collection.

    Exceptions

    • COMException

      An error occurred during the call to the underlying interface.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The property value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • AddRange(PropertyValueCollection)

    Appends the contents of the PropertyValueCollection object to this collection.

    public void AddRange (System.DirectoryServices.PropertyValueCollection value);

    Parameters

    • value
      PropertyValueCollection

      A PropertyValueCollection object that contains the objects to append to this collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The property value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • AddRange(Object[])

    Appends the contents of the specified PropertyValueCollection object to this collection.

    public void AddRange (object[] value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object[]

      The PropertyValueCollection array that contains the objects to append to this collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The property value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • Contains(Object)

    Determines whether the specified PropertyValueCollection object is in this collection.

    public bool Contains (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      The PropertyValueCollection object to search for in this collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified property belongs to this collection; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(Object[],Int32)

    Copies all PropertyValueCollection objects in this collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index in the target array.

    public void CopyTo (object[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Object[]

      The array of PropertyValueCollection objects that receives the elements of this collection.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array where this method starts copying this collection.

  • IndexOf(Object)

    Retrieves the index of a specified property value in this collection.

    public int IndexOf (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      The property value to find.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the specified property value. If the object is not found, the return value is -1.

  • Insert(Int32,Object)

    Inserts a property value into this collection at a specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, object value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which to insert the property value.

    • value
      Object

      The property value to insert.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The property value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • COMException

      An error occurred during the call to the underlying interface.

    • IndexOutOfRangeException

      The index is less than 0 (zero) or greater than the size of the collection.

  • OnClearComplete()

    Overrides the stem.Collections.CollectionBase.OnClearComplete* method.

    protected override void OnClearComplete ();
  • OnInsertComplete(Int32,Object)

    Overrides the stem.Collections.CollectionBase.OnInsertComplete* method.

    protected override void OnInsertComplete (int index, object value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which to insert value.

    • value
      Object

      The new value of the element at index.

  • OnRemoveComplete(Int32,Object)

    Overrides the stem.Collections.CollectionBase.OnRemoveComplete* method.

    protected override void OnRemoveComplete (int index, object value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which value can be found.

    • value
      Object

      The value of the element to remove from index.

  • OnSetComplete(Int32,Object,Object)

    Overrides the stem.Collections.CollectionBase.OnSetComplete* method.

    protected override void OnSetComplete (int index, object oldValue, object newValue);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which oldValue can be found.

    • oldValue
      Object

      The value to replace with newValue.

    • newValue
      Object

      The new value of the element at index.

  • Remove(Object)

    Removes a specified property value from this collection.

    public void Remove (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      The property value to remove.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The property value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • COMException

      An error occurred during the call to the underlying interface.

    Remarks

    When working with a multi-valued string property value, the Remove method will successfully remove the correct item. However, identifying the correct items by name is difficult with a multi-valued DNWithString property value (as the DNWithString COM class, which is used to store the DNWithString items, has 2 string properties representing the item). The way to remove such items is to find the object in the collection (by looping thru all the items), then call the Remove function with the object's pointer that you just found. This is illustrated in the example below.

    Example

    
// Bind to the AD object  
DirectoryEntry myUser = new DirectoryEntry("LDAP://AdServer:389/CN=MyUsername,CN=Users,DC=contoso,DC=com");  

// Get the attribute  
PropertyValueCollection testAttribute = myUser.Properties["someAttribute"];  

// Find the item in the collection that we want to delete  
DNWithString dnwsItemToRemove = null;  
foreach (DNWithString dnwsItem in testAttribute)  
{  
    if (dnwsItem.StringValue.Equals("SomeValue"))  
    {  
        dnwsItemToRemove = dnwsItem;  
        break;  
    }  
}  

// Delete it  
testAttribute.Remove(dnwsItemToRemove);  

// Store the data  
myUser.CommitChanges();
